intro: Lepismium grandiflorum, commonly known as the grandiflorum lily or the Mexican lily, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It is a member of the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters, with woody stems and evergreen foliage. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. Lepismium grandiflorum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
